metadata.Title: CVE-2019-11716 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Until explicitly accessed by script, window.globalThis is not enumerable and, as a result, is not visible to code such as Object.getOwnPropertyNames(window). Sites that deploy a sandboxing that depends on enumerating and freezing access to the window object may miss this, allowing their sandboxes to be bypassed. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 68.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-11716` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 68.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 68.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 68.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 68.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '68.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
